title: American Ballet Theatre at the Met
creator_credit: Brian Large and National Video Corporation
brief_description: These three wonderful ballets plus a pas de deux were performed by the American Ballet Theater at the Metropolitan Opera House, New York, on 11 June 1984. Les Sylphides: Music by Frideric Chopin, choreography by Michel Fokine, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Mikhail Baryshnikov, Cynthia Harvey, Marianna Tcherkassky, Cheryl Yeager. Sylvia: Music by Leo Delibes, choreography by George Balanchine, conducted by Alan Barker and featuring dancers Patrick Bissell, Martina Van Hamel. Triad: Music by Serge Prokofiev, choreography by Kenneth MacMillan, conducted by Alan Barker with violin solo by Dennis Cleveland and featuring dancers Robert La Fosse, Amanda McKerrow, Johan Renvall. Paquita: Music by Ludwig Minkus, choreography by Natalia Makarova, conducted by Paul Connelly and featuring dancers Fernando Bujones, Cynthia Gregory.
